data.title: Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award
data.text:
By submitting a nomination for the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award, all applicants hereby acknowledge and agree to these Terms and Conditions, which are detailed below:

General Provisions

Applicants acknowledge and accept to be bound by these Terms and Conditions, which include by reference FAO’s general Terms and Conditions. In the event of a conflict or inconsistency between these Terms and Conditions and FAO’s general Terms and Conditions, the present Terms and Conditions shall prevail to the extent necessary to resolve such conflict or inconsistency.

FAO has the right to consider ineligible any application forms that are incomplete and any applications that do not comply with the terms and conditions specified or are submitted beyond the deadline.

FAO will not pay any fees, nor pay any costs relating to, participation in the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award, apart from the prize outlined for the award winner.

Information provided by applicants who wish to submit an application, including Contact Data and Personal Data as defined in FAO’s Privacy Policy, when registering via the form will be processed by FAO in accordance with FAO’s corporate rules, procedures, policies and practice, including its Privacy Policy, to the exclusion of any single national system of law. Such information will be used and may be made available to third parties exclusively for services related to and within the purposes of the FAO Awards page or FAO institutional activities.

FAO reserves the right to verify the eligibility of applicants or that of any entry (including users’ identity and address) and to consider not eligible any application that is not in accordance with these Terms and Conditions or who tampers with the entry process. By submitting entries to the CPF, applicants agree that their Contact and Personal Data may be processed, shared, and otherwise used for the purposes and within the context of the FAO Awards and any other purposes outlined in these Terms and Conditions.

Data protection and privacy notice

FAO is committed to processing personal data fairly, with integrity, responsibility, security, and transparency in accordance with its internal data protection rules and policies.

FAO collects and processes personal data for the purposes of managing the nominations for the award as well as accurately assessing the submissions. The data may also be used by FAO to verify the nominee’s identity, postal address and telephone number or to otherwise verify the nominee’s eligibility for the award.

FAO may share your personal data with selected third parties (duly authorized partners or jury members) to perform services for FAO based on the above purpose.

FAO makes every effort to ensure that those third parties afford a level of protection and safeguards that are the same as or comparable to FAO.

If you have any questions or concern related to your personal data processed by FAO, please contact us at [email protected]. Please also read the FAO Data Protection and Privacy Notice for more information about how FAO processes your personal data.

Responsibility of Applicants

Applicants acknowledge and agree that they:

will comply with all applicable laws, including, without limitation, privacy laws, intellectual property laws, anti-spam laws;

cannot create a false identity, or misrepresent their identity, affiliation with a person or entity, past or present, or their current or previous positions and qualifications;

are responsible for ensuring the accuracy, integrity and security of the information that they provide when accessing the Application Form, including any Contact or Personal Data;

Unless otherwise indicated, applicants acknowledge and agree that the material submitted through the Application Form may be reused and redistributed by others for non-commercial purposes, in line with the objectives of the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award, without requesting prior written permission. Where specific authorization to reuse and redistribute material is required, applicants must obtain the necessary permission from the respective rights holder(s).

By registering and submitting the entries, applicants agree that FAO may - in accordance with the choices made by them about who can see their content or information, when applicable - reproduce, distribute, display and create derivate works, without any further consent, notice and/or compensation to them or others, of the data provided in the nomination form, including Contact and Personal Data, in connection with the purpose of the FAO Awards and the promotion of FAO’s work, on the:

CPF website;

FAO corporate websites: www.fao.org;

Corporate videos or digital recordings to illustrate the work of the Organization;

Printed FAO publications or brochures;

Social media channels;

Any other media used by FAO in its communications.

At any time, applicants can request FAO to delete, review, correct or update their Contact or Personal Data by writing to [email protected].

Changes to these Terms and Conditions will be posted on this webpage and will be available via the FAO website. By participating in the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award subsequent to FAO making available an amended version of these Terms and Conditions, applicants acknowledge, agree and consent to such amendment(s).

Disclaimer and limitation of liability

The information on the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award is provided for the convenience of users.

The mention of an institution or of its services on the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award website, does not imply that these have been endorsed, accredited or recommended by FAO.

FAO reserves the right to discontinue and/or modify, for any reason and without notice, at any time, the posting of any or all of the information contained on the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award website.

FAO shall not be liable for any loss or damage arising from, or directly or indirectly connected to, the use of, reference to, or reliance on any content provided in the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award website, including, but not limited to, any liability arising from any intentional or negligent misuse, errors, disclosure, undue transfer, loss or destruction of data that may occur.

The designations employed and the presentation of material through the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award website do not imply the expression of any opinion whatsoever on the part of FAO, concerning the legal or development status of any country, territory, city or area or of its authorities, or concerning the delimitation of its frontiers or boundaries.

Privileges and Immunities

Nothing contained in or related to these Terms and Conditions, nor any acts performed or statements made in relation to the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award including the CPF Wangari Maathai Forest Champions Award website, shall be deemed as a waiver, express or implied, of any of the privileges and immunities of FAO, or as its acceptance of the applicability of any national laws, or of the jurisdiction of the courts of any country over disputes arising out of, or in connection with, these Terms and Conditions.
